com.project.currency

Interface IAppManager


  • public interface IAppManager
    The IAppManager interface is responsible for managing the entire application's logical part. Storing, refreshing an handling the data.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getCurrenciesArray()
      Iterating the HashMap and returns ArrayList of Strings that will be shown at the GUI.
      java.util.Date getFileDate()
      Retrieves the file's date as a Date Object.
      boolean isDataUpToDate(java.util.Date fileDate, int timeTriggerInHours)
      Checking whether the data is up to date by a given date time as an argument, and checking the delta with a given fixed time.
      boolean refreshDataAndCheckForSuccess()
      Downloads data and parsing it.
      Coin stringToCoin(java.lang.String coinName)
      Receiving a string which represent a coin's key in the HashMap and returns the relevant coin Object according to it.

    • Method Detail

      • isDataUpToDate

        boolean isDataUpToDate(java.util.Date fileDate,
                     int timeTriggerInHours)
        Checking whether the data is up to date by a given date time as an argument, and checking the delta with a given fixed time.
        Parameters:
        fileDate - the reference date- the date of the current downloaded file.
        timeTriggerInHours - the chosen time amount considered to be out of date.
        Returns:
        an answer that indicates whether the chosen amount of time has passed.

      • refreshDataAndCheckForSuccess

        boolean refreshDataAndCheckForSuccess()
        Downloads data and parsing it. Checking for whole operation success (two condition: file download and XML parsing).
        Returns:
        an answer that indicates whether the data was refreshed successfully.

      • getCurrenciesArray

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getCurrenciesArray()
        Iterating the HashMap and returns ArrayList of Strings that will be shown at the GUI. Each element in the ArrayList includes the country name and currency name
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of Strings storing the currency and country names.

      • stringToCoin

        Coin stringToCoin(java.lang.String coinName)
        Receiving a string which represent a coin's key in the HashMap and returns the relevant coin Object according to it.
        Parameters:
        coinName - a string representing the coin's name to convert to Coin type.
        Returns:
        a specific Coin Object.

      • getFileDate

        java.util.Date getFileDate()
        Retrieves the file's date as a Date Object.
        Returns:
        the file's date as a Date Object.
